subject: Mechanical Technology

overview.description: Comprehensive mechanical technology curriculum providing hands-on training in mechanical engineering principles, manufacturing processes, and industrial applications for technical career preparation

learning_objectives: Master fundamental mechanical engineering principles and applications
Develop practical skills in mechanical design and manufacturing
Understand industrial machinery operation and maintenance
Apply safety protocols and quality control measures
Prepare for technical careers and further engineering education

units.title: Engineering Drawing and CAD Design
learning_outcomes: Master technical drawing standards and conventions
Use CAD software for mechanical design
Create detailed engineering drawings and blueprints

lessons.title: 3D CAD Modeling and Assembly Design
objectives: Create 3D models of mechanical components using CAD software
Design mechanical assemblies with proper constraints

activities.description: Create 3D models of mechanical parts using professional CAD software
Design mechanical assemblies with moving parts and constraints
Generate detailed 2D drawings from 3D models with dimensions and tolerances
Peer review and feedback on CAD designs

cross_curricular_connections: Engineering Drawing: Technical standards and conventions

units.title: Materials Science and Manufacturing Processes
learning_outcomes: Understand properties and selection of engineering materials
Apply machining, welding, and fabrication techniques
Understand quality control and inspection methods

lessons.title: Machining Operations and CNC Programming
objectives: Operate conventional and CNC machine tools safely
Program CNC machines for basic machining operations
Apply appropriate cutting tools and parameters

activities.description: Operate lathes, milling machines, and drilling equipment
Program CNC machines for turning and milling operations
Measure and inspect machined parts using precision instruments
Review safety protocols and best practices

cross_curricular_connections: Computer Technology: CNC programming and automation

units.title: Thermodynamics and Fluid Mechanics
learning_outcomes: Understand principles of thermodynamics and heat transfer
Apply fluid mechanics concepts to practical systems
Analyze engine cycles and power systems

lessons.title: Engine Performance Analysis and Testing
objectives: Conduct engine testing and data collection
Understand engine efficiency and emission control

activities.description: Disassemble and inspect internal combustion engine components
Conduct engine performance tests using dynamometer
Analyze performance data and calculate efficiency parameters
Discuss methods for improving engine performance and efficiency

units.title: Automation and Control Systems
learning_outcomes: Understand principles of automation and control
Program and operate PLCs and industrial control systems
Apply sensors and actuators in control applications

lessons.title: PLC Programming and Industrial Automation
objectives: Program PLCs for industrial control applications
Design and implement automated manufacturing systems
Interface sensors and actuators with control systems

activities.description: Program PLCs using ladder logic for control applications
Design automated systems for manufacturing processes
Build and test automated control systems
Practice troubleshooting and maintenance of control systems

cross_curricular_connections: Electrical Technology: Control circuits and electrical systems
Computer Technology: Programming and system integration

workshop_projects: Complete mechanical assembly fabrication from design to production
Engine rebuild and performance optimization project
Automated manufacturing cell design and implementation
Precision machining and quality control project
industrial_training: Machine shop operations and safety protocols
capstone_projects: Design and build mechanical device solving real-world problem
Automation system for local industry application
Innovation in manufacturing process or product

technical_certifications: NIMS (National Institute for Metalworking Skills) credentials
professional_development: Society of Manufacturing Engineers (SME) student membership
American Society of Mechanical Engineers (ASME) activities
Industry trade show and conference participation

equipment_and_facilities: Fully equipped machine shop with conventional and CNC equipment
